page.title: 03Lytchett Matravers Church
page.content: The{13th century}parish church built of local stone is about{half a {mile from the village}of Lytchett Matravers. There are 3 ancient yews in the old churchyard and it is surounded by an ancient stone wall. A new car park has been laid out under the wall to the north whilst to the south stretches the burial ground used today. The services are well attended on Sundays and weekdays, and the church is used for{baptisms, marriages and {funerals.}The rector is a young man of 34, and his wife is a deaconess and they have two small daughters. The church, as ever, is looking for funds for maintenance. It's{most {valuable possesion}is the{silver {goblet and plate}dated 1574. Once a month united services are held with the Methodist congregation.
